page.title: 12FARMING, HASELOR, WARKS.
page.content: I went to ask Mr.Goulbourne about his farming. He has a fairly large dairy herd. He and his dairyman milk the cows twice a day. The cows come into the milking parlour and most of them like to have the same milking bay each time. His cows have coloured tapes on their tails,these indicate how much milk the cow gives and that cow is given a quantity of cow cake as it is being milked;the more milk it gives the more cake it has. Mr.Goulbourne also keeps turkeys to fatten them up for Christmas. Just before Christmas he employs local people to come to pluck and dress the turkeys. Some he sends to the local markets others he sells to his regular customers who order their Christmas turkey from him each year. He says that turkeys are very nervous creatures. He grows some crops to feed his own livestock.
